Tips for prospective students
In three sentences
Comments

The campus is safe. I have never had any scary incident. The campus police are always ready to walk students to their cars any time of the day for any reason. They also offer life skills to students such as training to protect oneself, how to react in emergency situations, and many others. Students should look into those programs.
Join the Truckee Meadows Community College Phi Theta Kappa Honor Society. It is indulging, cheering, and motivating.
Join the honor society. Engage in student government. Some times the college host student social activities. There are severally clubs to join in the campus depending on one's interests.

It is great for a student who is looking for a quiet college. A student who wants to work closely with professor or who wants to transition from high school to college life. Students who want to attend college in a small city.
I have not encountered any unusual traditions at the college. I am pretty familiar with every location on campus. It is a small campus that has some charm.

When I first joined, i though it was a bang for the buck but, tuition cost has increase and it seem to be getting higher and higher. Take all the cheaper classes at community college and for those that it doesn't offer, take at the university if you're on a budget.
Join the honor society. Engage in student government. Some times the college host student social activities. Students can also attend meetings that discuss the future of tuition cost.
The food from the cafeteria is always fresh and health. They also provide different or new dishes at times. Although if you are on a budget, it will drain your pocket.
There are no dorms at TMCC. It's a junior or community college. student live off campus.

Education is intense. It involves a higher level of understanding. Some of the courses are tough but, the professors make it very clear what they expect from you during the course. IF a student follows the professors guidance they'll pass. Schedule your classes ahead of time or else you'll regret it.
Prospective students should always seek help and work hard. Do not struggle alone. Every college employee is there to help you realize your dreams. Please always remember to help them help you.

Truckee Meadows community College is the most decent 2 year degree college to pursue an early college education. It has the most supportive and helpful personnel who are willing to go the extra mile to help students out. The campus atmosphere always encourages a positive attitude.
pageTitle: Truckee Meadows Community College Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {465995=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 138284=I don't know what the young students do for fun here but in the summer time we have the air races here, balloon races, camel races, hot august nights, just to name a few, and concerts on the river every night for free., 45240=it my first semester since high school which i graduated in 2003. i would have to update you on this, but i'm hoping its a challenge since i've been out of school since 2003., 113520=Beautiful campus with a diverse student body. Several web based classes online which is great for adult/non-traditional students. Cost of tuition per semester is very reasonable - four classes $1200., 329372=At only 1000 dollars a semester for a full load of classes plus books, this is the best deal out there. Some of our teachers even teach at the nearby university as well so you are getting the same education at a much lower rate., 366487=When I started college back in 2002, I think it was $150 for a 3 credit class. Now it is only 253.5 for a 3 credit class, which isn't bad compared to UNR., 216838=Read everything and call several times to verify that you have the correct information. On average you need to call three times to receive accurate information. If someone dies in your immediate family and you ask for a week breavement, please be aware that it is up to the teacher to excuse you, my sister died in a car accident in the middle of the 2011 Fall semester. Only one teacher let me make up the week of work I missed due to funeral services and dealing with her death. If you have received bad information, let someone know, write a letter, as often you will find the students working in the financial aid office are not informed and give out the wrong information.}

textAfterTable: Am learning a lot Getting out of high school I did not learn a lot and was confused in many subjects. This college helped me learn even the most basic concepts that I did not understand in high school. Login to rate or flag the reviews Ashleigh from Sparks, NV 07/12/2011 Reviewer is A past student here. 2 out of 4 people found this review useful. 3 of 118 Categories Comments Great for these types of students People who can do most of the stuff on their own and have a lot of time. Tips for prospective students Ask follow students about the teachers and also go onto rate your professor.com it will help you not get the bad teachers. Bang for the buck Not a bad price for a community college Did enjoy being here
